fields.description: If you chose "edit this issue and change the summary line, it's contents will be spoiled after [save]. The first three characters of the summary line seem to be a random string. From the fourth char, the given text appears.
fields.summary: Summary and/or assignee corrupted during edits with Oracle 9.0.1

fields.description:
I have both a JIRA and a Confluence installation, Ive had them previously communicating amongst themselves for the authentication. I would like to get them to both talk to Active Directory and use that as a single source of security / group detailing.

I have found a few resources in the forums / mailing lists with fragments of advice on how to integrate Confluence into Active Directory using LDAP, but I have yet been able to put the peices together and get a working installation. (I get various stack traces on Tomcat startup)

What would be invaliuble to users in my situation is a guide (like the "Integrating Confluence and JIRA" documentation guide) taking us through, step by step, what is needed to be done in order to get an integrated system up and running.
fields.summary: Documentation for JIRA Integration with Active Directory

fields.description:
One way to optimize database performance for complex data is to take advantage of the database's stored procedure facilities. I don't know if this is possible with the current Entity Engine from the OFBiz project.

See
http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-04-2004/jw-0405-bottleneck_p.html
fields.summary: Use stored procedures to improve db performance

fields.description:
Please update the documentation http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v2.6.1/servers/weblogic.html

Please insert the hint:
Due to performance improvements ensure running BEA WebLogic Server in production mode.

See:
http://e-docs.bea.com/wls/docs81/ConsoleHelp/domain_domain_config_general.html
http://e-docs.bea.com/platform/docs81/confgwiz/newdom.html#devprod
http://e-docs.bea.com/wls/docs70/webapp/weblogic_xml.html

Furthermore change the following file: weblogic.xml
into jsp-descriptor element:
---
     <jsp-param>
       <param-name>pageCheckSeconds</param-name>
       <param-value>-1</param-value>
     </jsp-param>
---
into weblogic-web-app element:
---
   <container-descriptor>
     <servlet-reload-check-secs>-1</servlet-reload-check-secs>
   </container-descriptor>
---
fields.summary: Update "JIRA installation on BEA WebLogic" documentation
Release Notes should say "won't fix"

fields.description: The count of open issues by Component on the 'Browse Project' page is incorrect. I changed the components on several issues but the count by component does not reflect the change
fields.summary: Incorrect issue count by Component on 'Browse Project' page

fields.description:
Have not found too much documentation for how you'd want to deploy JIRA as a webapp on JBoss 3.2.x with MSSQL in the back-end, so please if you feel that I've not set it up correctly then say so.

Then again, we have indeed got a JIRA installation up and running but every time that JBoss is restarted and JIRA is re-deployed, it attempts to install all the database schema again. I have attached an excerpt of the log file when this occurs. However, JIRA manages to restart and seems to run fine, it just doesn't look too good (nor is too re-assuring) when we get lots of ERROR-statements related to the database storage/back-end.

My question is then whether something needs to be done with the configuration of JIRA to prevent this on successive startups, or whether it's possible to handle this more gracefully in later releases of JIRA?

Regards,

Trym
fields.summary: Restart of JBoss 3.2.3 with JIRA on MSSQL re-attempts installation
Improve dialog "Schedule Versions" with JavaScript

Thanks,
Davide

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=5298&tstart=0

com.opensymphony.module.user.authenticator.SmartAuthenticator

        at
org.jboss.mx.loading.UnifiedClassLoader3.loadClassImpl(UnifiedClassLoade
r3.java:169)

Whilst we are at it, we should go through and check that Class.forName() is not used in any os component.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3530].
  {panel}

The Time Tracking Report is wonderful, but I need more detail in order to make it useful for any kind of auditing/time & billing functions. Specifically:

1. I'd like to select a resource (user) to constrain the report to (and I'd like to be able to sort on two columns, for instance, by version and user or version and component).

2. I'd like to be able to specify a date-range to constrain the report to.

3. I'd like to have more filters (especially if I could define my own). A great set of options for the filters would be:
   a. Use current search settings
   b. Specified component
   c. Only over-budget tasks

4. Subtotals in each sorted group (so if it is sorted by component show subtotals for each component).
fields.summary: Time and materials reporting - accountability

fields.description:
1. If a 'find' returns more than one page of results, those results are split over several pages. 

2. If the grouping (the sort column) does not provide sufficient differentiation (eg., many of the issues are of the same priority), the ordering within the sorted group is random.

3. Consequently, when paging from one page to the next, issues are re-ordered and sometime INFORMATION CAN BE LOST because clicking "Next>>" will not show you all the issues.

This happens because the natural ordering of issues is not preserved in between pages. On page 1 of 3, issues might be ordered as such:

400
430
576
320

But, when I view the second page, this natural ordering changes within the sorted group. If the group does not provide a great deal of order (such as the date), the second page might select this result set:

430
400
320
576

If the result set is less than one page long, this doesn't matter. But if the result set is longer than a page, the random ordering can mean that some issues never appear while paging through the results, or that some issues appear more than once.

(You can try this by clicking on the "2.7 Pro" milestone, which is three pages long, and pay close attention to the order of the results. What is the last item on the first page? Go to the second page. Does that item appear again? Go back to the first page... odds are, it's not at the bottom of the page anymore... it might not even be on the page!).

This can be solved by adding a secondary sort to all queries. I would suggest sorting by <priority>,<issue#> (in other words, always do a secondary sort on the <issue#>).
fields.summary: Multi-page results within a set are randomly ordered

fields.description:
Jira 2.6.1 throws a ClassNotFoundException on initialisation when deployed in JBoss.

11:25:12,421 DEBUG [com.opensymphony.user.UserManager] loading using config : osuser.xml
11:25:12,436 DEBUG [com.opensymphony.user.util.ConfigLoader] Loading config
11:25:12,457 DEBUG [com.opensymphony.user.util.ConfigLoader] Authenticator class = com.opensymphony.module.user.authenticator.SmartAuthenticator {}
11:25:12,479 ERROR [com.opensymphony.user.util.ConfigLoader] Could not create instance of authenticator 
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: No ClassLoaders found for: com.opensymphony.module.user.authenticator.SmartAuthenticator
	at org.jboss.mx.loading.LoadMgr3.beginLoadTask(LoadMgr3.java:161)
	at org.jboss.mx.loading.UnifiedClassLoader3.loadClassImpl(UnifiedClassLoader3.java:169)
	at org.jboss.mx.loading.UnifiedClassLoader3.loadClass(UnifiedClassLoader3.java:123)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:255)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:315)
	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:140)
	at com.opensymphony.user.util.ConfigLoader.addAuthenticator(ConfigLoader.java:88)
	at com.opensymphony.user.util.ConfigLoader.access$200(ConfigLoader.java:37)
	at com.opensymphony.user.util.ConfigLoader$ConfigHandler.endElement(ConfigLoader.java:158)



The com.opensymphony.user.util.ConfigLoader does not check for ClassNotFoundException but does check for NoClassDefFoundError. This has been fixed in the current CVS version of OSUser.
fields.summary: ClassLoader error in JBoss

fields.description:
After: 
1) applying the quick fix from JIRA-3487
2) updating ant.jar to latest version (1.6.1).
3) deploying jira 2.6.1 Pro to seperate dir outside of webapps.
4) changing the context dir path to ref seperate dir.

You get the external Compile errors from Jasper when accessing app.

After:
1) moving 2.6.1 into webapps dir you get the jiraDS datasource errors mentioned in JIRA-968.

Problem:
To avoid the jiraDS issue I guess you have to have the jira in a dir outside of webapps so it does not get deployed twice. Upon doing this you get the executeExternalCompile(DefaultCompilerAdapter.java:426) error from Ant because the user it does not have write permission to anywhere it wants. This is easily seen because the logs show that the directory that I start Tomcat from is where it tries to create temporary files most of the time, other times it abitrarily picks a directory even outside of TOMCAT_HOME.

NOTES:
Deleting contents of work directory upon every try has no effect on compile errors.

The FORK option is NOT on in the web.xml of Tomcat.

The jira directory contains extracted contents of the built war not the war file itself. 

I can recreate this at will so if you want log files just let me know.
fields.summary: Tomcat - JIRA - Ant oddities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3523].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 7 March  2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello All,

Many thanks for your feedback and votes on this issue.

We know that this feature is highly voted for, however due to other priorities it is not something we are going to implement in the near future. We will update this request when we plan to include it in our roadmap.

For those that are unaware, JIRA allows for the default assignee to be the project lead or unassigned. Other than that you can use the component leads to auto-assign issues.

For any concerns please contact me directly. Otherwise let's keep the comments on track by indicating your use cases for this feature.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Management
roy at atlassian dot com
{panel}

\\

I cannot change the default assignee in projects from the administration console.
Assignable users are defined in the permission scheme, but JIRA does not allow me to modify the default assignee, which is defined as the Project Lead by JIRA. I think this is a bug, because by reading some previously submitted issues, it seams that JIRA allows to change the default assignee and select a specific user.
fields.summary: Cannot change the default assignee

fields.description:
My manager _double_ clicked on start progress when he was evaluating the software. This caused a: 
HTTP Status 404 - No view for result [error] exists for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]
type Status report

message No view for result [error] exists for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]

description The requested resource (No view for result [error] exists for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]) is not available.
Apache Tomcat/4.1.29

When he went back to the screen he kept getting this message when he single clicked on start progress. By manually refreshing the screen (F5) it updated to show that the project was now stopped.

This is fully reproducible on my PC too.
fields.summary: 404 Tomcat error when double clicking on start progress

fields.description:
I tried to fix a due date in a new issue. I open the calendar window which provide me a date like this :
"23-Apr-2004"
But when i tried to submit this new issue Jira don't want because of incorrect date format. It except to find a date with this format :
"23-Avril-2004" (according to my host locale i think). In Jira this user choose English language.

Hope it help you

Eric
fields.summary: Date format error in french regional

fields.description:
We have a lot of projects (about 50). Some people would like to see all projects (with statictic bargraph) in their dashboard but because each project take a lot a height it is impossible.

The idea is to add another option for project portlet : "standard".
Standard will be like full but with no filter and perhaps you can change brief option to add the statistic bar graph which provide a easy way to see all projects.

Thanks 

Eric
fields.summary: Another option to projects portlet (standard)

fields.description:
A user has sign up with the user name "m&m". The i tried to modify this user. Because the username is passed as url parameter (FooServlet?name=m&m : GET or POST method) the servlet container cut the name and try to retreive the username named "m" !!!

The only way is to use a database client, change the username and restart the servlet container.
fields.summary: Character not allowed in user name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3517].
  {panel}

We were very impressed by the feature of "automagic issue linking" where using a known issue-key in any form of comment would result in a link pointing that very issue.

I would like to request a similar feature of "automagic user linking and mailing". One could create an issue, or comment on one, and use a known username. JIRA then not only adds a link to that user (not so useful) but also generates and sends an e-mail to that user notifying of this issue's change, possibly inviting him/her to watch it. 

Ex:
Comment "This is something I need j.doe for." would result in the actual comment "This is something that I need John Doe for." and an e-mail to j.doe@blah.com with a notification.
fields.summary: Linking users automagically

fields.description: It would be useful to add a custom issue field type for URLs. For example we would use it to tie together JIRA issues with cases logged in our customer service case management system by specifying the case id URL in a custom issue field .
fields.summary: Add URL Custom Field

fields.description: It is not possible to attach screen shot at several client PC's to my errors.
fields.summary: Screenshot can not be attached

fields.description:
PostgreSQL 7.3 an up support schemas. Ofbiz' Entity Engie whcih is used for database communication in JIRA does not handle that very well. During startup the following will appear in the log files:

2004-04-01 14:20:18,428 WARN [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "Action" has no table in the database
2004-04-01 14:20:18,517 ERROR [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create table "jiraaction"
2004-04-01 14:20:18,517 ERROR [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE jiraaction (ID NUMERIC(18,0) NOT NULL, issueid NUMERIC(18,0), AUTHOR VARCHAR(255), actiontype VARCHAR(255), actionlevel VARCHAR(255), actionbody TEXT, CREATED TIMESTAMP, actionnum NUMERIC(18,0), CONSTRAINT PK_jiraaction PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: java.sql.SQLException: ERROR:  Relation 'jiraaction' already exists

for every table in the database. 
JIRA will continue to work.

The problem is more serious when upgarding from a previous version of JIRA, as in version 2.6 extra columns were created (since 2.5). During startup ofbiz fails to determine that the table exists and tries to create it, as the table is actually there the creation fails. Ofbiz does not try to add extra columns after that. When JIRA tries to export data before running the upgrade tasks the export fails as some columns do not exist in the database.
fields.summary: PostgreSQL 7.3 entity creation failure

We have a single issue that was resolved then reopened, then worked on and then finnaly the developper wanted to resolve the issue. The gui does not give a link to be able to resolve the issue. I have checked the permission scheme and even looked at the XML dump of the data, but cannot find anything about the specific issue that would make it not resolvable.

  <Issue assignee="kzalazni" created="2003-12-07 17:04:21.441"
    description="On a search screen when you do not find the item you are looking for the system should ask if you want to create a new one. On the Advanced Client Search it does not work this way. "
    id="10185" key="PAS-171" priority="4" project="10000"
    reporter="kzalazni" status="4"
    summary="Create Person when no search results" timeestimate="0"
    timespent="1800" type="1" updated="2004-03-31 14:26:27.842"

fields.description:
There is strange bug in Tomcat that entries that are created in the database can not be retrieve using the GenericDelegator.

I'm not sure if this is a Transaction bug or something else.

E.g.
The users are created when importing but can't be found in the next step.
The workflow created can not be assigned to the Issue as the entry does not exist.

This Issue requires some deeper investigation.
fields.summary: CSV Import does work in Tomcat

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3509].
  {panel}

Right now, issue types and priorities are merely a lable, a description and an icon. I would like to see something much more useful. 

Part of this is because I expect to modify the workflows to encapsulate our business processes to the greatest extent possible by JIRA and what I can con our "Powers That Be" into letting me do. 

I would like to be able to assign different work flows to different types of issues. 

For instance, our feature requests have to be prioritized by a specific committee (at least major feature requests) so the workflow for feature requests will need to go through a workflow that takes it through that committee processes where it will be prioritized and scheduled and so on before being sent to development. 

In addition each issue type needs to have a diferent set of information. A good example of this is with the current setup. I think that for the most part the environment is not meaningful for new features. If I'm going to have different workflows for each issue type, I'm going to need different data to run those workflows.

I would also like to have different priority sets for each type of issue. 

I think it would also be useful to establish who can create which types of issue (as a member of the public, I should never be able to create a task, for instance) and also which priorities they are able to set. It possible that I only want certain people to set the priority to certain values (for instance the "Oh no! Fix this now or the whole company is going into the toilet" priority should probably only be set by Managers).
fields.summary: Extend Issues Type and Priority behaviour

fields.description:
There is help (accessible via the speech bubble icon next to priority in  the create issue screen) that describes the various priorities. However, the description is only meaningful in the case of Bugs. 

A critical Improvement or Feature request does not prevent development or testing. What it probably means is that the feature is sufficiently important to be a deciding factor in purchase decisions (or some such). 

We have a real problem where users never set the right priority and it will only be made worse with the introduction of many issue types. 

I have actually waffled between calling this major and calling it minor because I feel that it can cause significant issues for business processes, especially if you attach "urgency" or process to different priorities.
fields.summary: Improve the description of Priorities

fields.description:
I am passing this on in case the ideas are useful to Atlassian.

The current custom field code does not scale very well in regards to the issue navigator.  We have over 700 custom fields, and displaying a simple list of issues (i.e. "Assigned to Me") was taking too long:

  [4525ms] - /batt/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa
    [721ms] - IssueNavigator.execute()
    ...
    [2781ms] - ColumnLayoutManager.getColumnLayout()
    ...

After researching and understanding the code and making some improvements, we were able to reduce this dramatically:

  [667ms] - /batt/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa
    [19ms] - IssueNavigator[JiraWebActionSupport].execute()
    ...
    [318ms] - IssueNavigator.getColumns()
    ...

What we did was:

1. Improved use of Lucene

   Of the 721ms in IssueNavigator.execute(), approximately 
   690ms was used reopening the index for every query (these
   numbers are worse if the issues are not in the cache).
   We implemented an IndexListener interface to send out 
   events whenever the index was refreshed (i.e.
   IndexManager.reIndexIssues()), and now only reopen the 
   index when it changes.

   For most queries, the commment index is not used, and so
   we now use the actual Lucene Document object to display
   search results, instead of querying the database for a
   GenericEntity.  In order to do this, we changed some of
   the names of the Fields in the Lucene index to exactly 
   match the entity definition, and then instead of passing
   a GenericEntity to the JSP, we pass a SearchResult.  The
   information for the search result is read lazily from the
   Lucene Hits object (not read until needed).  Sorting is
   done by Lucene.  If the comment index is used, the code
   takes the existing path using the database (but note that
   this is only for user queries - none of the "built in"
   queries such as Open Issues, Assigned to Me, etc. use the
   comment index).

   Note that the combination of these two means the Lucene
   IndexReader is not explicitly closed, but wrapped in an
   object which closes it when it is garbage collected.

2. Improved ColumnLayout usage

   The interaction between the JSP and LayoutManager regarding
   columns is very inefficient.  In many cases ArrayList
   objects are used, which must be searched sequentially to 
   find matching columns.  Also, during one display of the 
   IssueNavigator, the layout is queried several times, and
   column information retrieved from the store many times
   (for example, IssueNavigator.getColumns() is used to
   return a visible list of columns, but then the
   FieldLayoutManager is queried again for each column to 
   see if it is visible).

   We changed some of the internal cached lists to be hashed
   (i.e. DefaultFieldManager.orderableFields).  Also, we made
   our own implementation of IssueNavigator.getColumns()
   and FieldLayoutManager.isFieldHidden() to avoid repeated
   field lookups.  Really, it could be improved a lot more by
   rewriting the JSP to not go back through the FieldManager 
   once the visible list of columns is retrieved.

These changes have been working quite well for us.
fields.summary: custom fields do not scale / IssueNavigator too slow

fields.description:
Lotus Notes link files are text files. When they're downloaded from the server, they should have their mime type set to "application/vnd.lotus-notes" instead of "text/plain".

Configuring the web.xml files doesn't help as Jira appears set the mime type itself for the attachments.

A global way of setting overriding mimetypes based on file extension would be enough to solve our needs.

http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/vnd.lotus-notes
fields.summary: Attached Lotus Notes link files (.ndl) do not get the proper mime type

fields.description:
Any issues with comments show:  Velocity template generation failed.

the only stack trace is in std.out as follows:

2004-03-31 10:59:39,473 ERROR [jira.issue.action.AbstractGVIssueAction] org.apache.velocity.exception.VelocityException: Could not find template 'templates\jira\issue\action\comment.vm' ensure it is in the classpath.

fields.summary: User list is not sorted when filtered
Allow Versions of components

fields.description:
We use the JIRA web-app in our enterprise app, using a custom authenticator and user manager.  We store user properties in the OSUser objects (which uses the OSUser EJB store).

JIRA is intent on bulk loading all our properties every time it does everything, and many times per request!

There are some things I've changed to make the performance less bad on our system (as it's rather slow to have several thousand DB hits per page request).

First, com.atlassian.core.user.preferences.UserPreferences - the default constructor bulkloads every user with this(pUser, true);  Can this be changed to this(pUser, false)? Is there ever a time when bulkloading is a good thing?  Even better, can the backingPS returned be cached for the duration of the request?  Things creating a new UserPreferences cause hits on the database for items that have been cached in other instances, but not in this one (i.e. can we share the result of PropertySetManager.getInstance("cached", params); for the duration of the request?).

In com.atlassian.jira.config.properties.PropertiesManager the singleton's a step forward, but the loadPropertySet method insists on bulkloading everything - does this really have to be done?

By changing only these two things, the DB access is cut down significantly for us.
fields.summary: Remove needless DB queries

fields.description:
From my dashboard I click a personal filter. In the filter summary it says

 Project: XL Maintenance
 Resolution: Unresolved
 Assign To: yan
 Sorted by: /field(./field)/nameKey descending 

I was not expecting to see '/field(./field)/nameKey'.

This filter was created in an earlier version of JIRA. I do not see this raw code for a filter I created today.
fields.summary: Filter Statistics Portlet Raw XPathy stuff in filter summary

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3498].
  {panel}

We use the XML export/import facility all the time.  

It is particulalry useful in getting data into a second temporary (local) installation when we don't have access to our servers for admin purposes (e.g. when we're onsite at our clients and behind a firewall, which is 99% of the time).

What's really inconvenient is that the attachments do not get included into the export in any way.

Some way of getting these through to the client (e.g. zip up the directory and download to client) would save us a lot of time.
fields.summary: Ability to export attachments during XML backup

fields.description:
Even though a user (or group) has rights to set a issue to closed/resolved etc, the option to do this doesn't appear.

In the catalina.out there're  a lot of messages like these :

[ERROR] AbstractWorkflow - -Error checking available actions <java.lang.NullPointerException>java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.opensymphony.workflow.spi.ofbiz.OfbizWorkflowStore.findEntry(OfbizWorkflowStore.java:166)
        at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.getAvailableActions(AbstractWorkflow.java:106)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.ViewIssue.loadAvailableActions(ViewIssue.java:412)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.ViewIssue.getAvailableActions(ViewIssue.java:391)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor95.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)


I've upgraded from 2.5.3 to 2.6.1 , some issues I can now close, but the problem still persists on others.
fields.summary: missing actions, close, resolve etc. + related error in logfile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3496].
  {panel}

We have a button "report a bug" in our web application, which forwards directly to the "Create New Issue" page in JIRA. 

It would be nice if we would be able to put a link like

http://.../CreateIssue.jspa?pid=10000&issuetype=1&summary=New%20organization%20page

under the button on our page and the Summary field of the "Create New Issue" page in JIRA would already contain the "New organization page" text.


The same should work for any field (including custom), of course.
fields.summary: abilty to put field values into create issue url

fields.description:
This is related to the issue here:

  http://jira.opensymphony.com/browse/CORE-56

Looks like it is fixed in 2.2.3.

We need to upgrade to oscore 2.2.3.
fields.summary: TextUtils can throw StringIndexOutOfBoundsException

fields.description:
The GROUP NAME is used as foreign in the following tables : CHANGEITEM, FILTERSUBSCRIPTION, JIRAPERMS, MEMBERSHIPBASE, SEARCHREQUEST.
Due to this, it's difficult to rename a group and there can be data integrity problems since there's no cnstraint defined on the group name column.
The GROUP ID column should be the only foreign key used to refer to the GROUPBASE table.
fields.summary: The group name is used as foreign key instead of the group id
Attach screenshot feature should store as png instead of jpg

All bulk assign attempts go to "default assigned"

fields.description:
JIRA currently sets a system property that is really not needed.

This is a problem for those who run JIRA in a managed environment.

We should remove this call.
fields.summary: JIRA sets System Property when not needed
Multiple JIRAs will not run in same JVM

fields.description: Currently, if I release a version (but do not archive it), it is removed from both the Affects Versions pulldown and the Fix Version pulldown.  This is correct behavior for the Fix Version, as a released version should not have more work done on it.  However, it is definitely possible to find issues affecting released versions, and this can't currently be tracked.
fields.summary: Released versions should show up in the Affects Versions list

fields.description:
The upgrade to 2.6.1 is prevented due to the auto xml backup export crashing from an invalid character. I have db backups so an xml export is not necessary and the upgrade should allow option to switch off the auto-export if the error occurs but you want to proceed with the upgrade anyway.

A workaround for this problem would be very nice so I can upgrade my installation tonight as planned.
fields.summary: Can't upgrade to 2.6.1 due to auto xml export crash

fields.description: Apparently when a project is deleted, the change items aren't removed from the database.
fields.summary: Remove changeitems from database when issue is deleted

fields.description:
When a series of issues have been linked together using the "Link" feature, it is possible, when in the individual issue view, to see its dependancies and dependants and move to these by clicking on the required linked issue.

When the issues are displayed, say using the ALL filter, then they can be ordered by the displayed columns (click on the column).

But there is no column for "links" or link order, so it is not possible to see the issues, ordered by their link order.

This makes using links pretty hard since theres no sensible way to see the order and hence for folks to execute the issuess in the required order without a lot of point and click actions.
fields.summary: Reporting of Issue Link Order

fields.description:
<from JIRA-user mailing list post>

I'd like to make two improvements to the way Jira handles searching
for issues:
                                                                                                                                               
 - currently, when a search is performed, the entire set of found
   issues is loaded into memory.  in some cases this might be needed,
   but when a user is doing a search, only the issues for the first
   "frame" of hits needs to be loaded - the next can be loaded when
   (if) the user clicks to the next page of results.
                                                                                                                                               
 - Lucene 1.4 includes sorting code now, so that the sorting can
   be done efficiently inside Lucene, instead of afterwards in the
   application.
                                                                                                                                               
Changing both of these will dramatically speed up the response time
of doing issue searches.  For us, it would mean at least a ten-fold
improvement.
                                                                                                                                               
Looking into doing this, I've got some questions about the Lucene
code in Jira:

Why is there a comment index and an issue index?  It would seem more
efficient to have only one index, where the information needed to
find issues by comments is in the issue index.  Unless I'm not seeing                                                                                                                    it, there don't appear to be any searches specifically interested in the comment records themselves - only the issues that the comments
are in.
                                                                                                                                               
Is this correct?
                                                                                                                                               
Most of the values used to index in Lucene are stored as
Field.Keyword or Field.Text, which besides just indexing the field,
stores the value in the index.  Then, when a hit is retrieved from
the index, those values are retrieved (meaning all the text for
the Field is returned).  It does not appear, however, that any of
those retrieved values are ever used - all searches seem to go
through DefaultSearchProvider, which only uses a single field,
DocumentConstants.ISSUE_ID, and throws the rest away.  The ISSUE_ID
is used to re-retrieve the information out of the database (or
out of the issue cache, if it is there).
                                                                                                                                               
Is this also correct?
                                                                                                                                               
It seems like what needs to happen is for there to be some kind
of "IssueSearchResult" object which contains the values for found
issues, and that object used in the generation of the JSP instead
of a GenericEntity.  That way, the IssueSearchResult object could
get its values straight from Lucene, bypassing the database.
                                                                                                                                               
Does this seem a reasonable approach?
                                                                                                                                               
Thanks -
                                                                                                                                               
Tim
fields.summary: Investigate using Lucene for sorting results

fields.description:
Currently if you comment on an issue, then you also need to remember to go and watch that same issue.

Similar to the ability to assign at any stage, we should have the option to watch an issue after any action.

This would be a checkbox under the 'comment' box that asks if you want to watch the issue.

The user could specify a default preference for that checkbox.

Any other features for this?
fields.summary: Ability to watch issues at any stage

fields.description: As my boss suggested, being able to integrate something like fisheye (http://fisheye.thecortex.net/) into jira would be a very useful feature. I realize that there is already a certain amount of repository integration but fisheye has some very nice features that I would like to see. Specifically, something like the changesets but connected to issues  would be nice.
fields.summary: Get a view into version control repository

fields.description: I'd like to be able, as a user, to add the current number of votes to my issue navigator. Since people who use voting are often going to use voting results to determine what features to add, I would be nice to be able to see that information in the summary. And make it sortable.
fields.summary: Add Vote count to to issue Navigator
Time tracking report: Optional resource column

fields.description:
There are a number of times when a simple totals row on find results would be incredibly useful.

Particularly, I would like to run a query for "all tasks assigned to Joe by version 0.8 that are Open" and see a total line at the bottom that tells me how much time is left in the estimated work column.
fields.summary: Totals row on results pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3475].
  {panel}

It would be absolutely wonderful to have a report that extends the basic developer workload report to include:

1. Version targets
2. Time & effort (similar to the time tracking report)

So, what I really, really want to know is:

1. By upcoming release version what is the workload for each person? This would allow me to see if a person has too much work assigned for the next milestone.

2. By upcoming release how is a developer tracking their particular work estimates? This would allow me to more accurate predict their individual estimation skills (eg., maybe we have one person that's lousy at estimates, but it's hard to tell because I can't classify estimate by person)
fields.summary: Workload report detail, by version
When creating release notes for a project, allow selection a range of versions

fields.description:
We have multiple clients using Jira, and we'd prefer to keep them separate.

Currently, the "Send Email" functionality to notify Jira users just places all of the address in the "To:" field, visible to all users.

Recommend either sending mails individually (so users only see their address in the "To:" field) or placing all the addresses in the "Bcc" field.
fields.summary: Email sent via "Send Email" should not display addresses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3471].
  {panel}

On Windows servers it is tricky to order the startup of processes so as to guarantee that the database (eg. Oracle) is up before JIRA is started.  We may be able to work around this by:
 - Checking on startup for a valid database connection
 - If the connection is invalid:
   - Send the usual johnson event to mark JIRA as unavailable, but also:
   - set a service that periodically retries the database connection, and if it comes up, do all the initialization tasks (regenerate stats),  remove the unavailable flag and remove the service.
fields.summary: Recover from an initially disconnected database
Show links in issue XML view

fields.description: Should show estimated/spent/remaining time
fields.summary: Add time info to issue XML view
How about Estimated Effort for the task? Do you have that feature?
Index users

fields.description:
It appears that this issue is not fixed:

JRA-2042
fields.summary: Permission "Assign Issues" for "Current Assignee" doesn't work right

fields.description:
Currently, JIRA allows due dates to be scheduled for issues. The next obvious step is to allow due dates for releases. With those two pieces in place, a calendar view could be added, which would greatly improve the use of JIRA in project management. Specs for this feature:

 * Calendar view that displays due dates for both issues and releases.
 * Ability to see dates for an individual project, or groups of projects.
 * Provide day, week, month, and three month views of data. Each view would have varying levels of detail based on how much room there is. As a very crude example, I've attached an image showing a three month view. The little green dots are supposed to be due dates for individual issues and the bigger red dots are due dates for releases. Putting your mouse over each item would give you a pop-up with the title of the item. A one-week view would provide quite a bit of detail  about each item such as the summary for an issue, and for a release perhaps a graph of the percentage of issues closed for the release.
 * Ability to embed different calendar views in the Dashboard. This can be used by a manager to get a snapshot for how development is going for the week/month, or by a developer to get an overview of what they're supposed to be working on for the day.

Justification for this feature:
 
Time management is a critical component of development and JIRA's current tools around time management are good at a granular level (management of time for individual issues), but crude at the meta level (ability to schedule out a release and all of it's sub-issues). A calendar view would allow JIRA to act as a single tool for project management in many respects.
fields.summary: Calendar system with due dates for releases

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to create a filter that spanned multiple projects, in particular by being able to search by a project category. While some project specific fields like "version" would not apply, it would be good to see all open issues in a whole category to get a master list of issues.
fields.summary: allow filtering by project category

fields.description:
We have been having various, not consistently reproducible errors all to do with security.

First, if you login in correctly.  If you mistype the password, the error screen comes up all scrambled.  This is not reproducible on demand.  Refreshing the screen (F5) causes the screen to be come more and more clear on each attempt.  The scrambled is visible HTML code on the page.  See the screenshot(s) I am attaching.  The screen does not always look exactly like this, but are similar in the fact that HTML code is visible to the user.

Second, when users are created the admin is forced to enter the username as all lower case, which is good.  However, when the user logs in, if they enter the correct name, but with some or all upper case then the user seems to be logged in, but they cannot see the project list or anything.  It should have instead, rejected their login attempt.  See my attachment for an example.

Third, the most dangerous...  We have a permission scheme setup to that has Administer Projects permission for a group.  If a member of that groups logs in, they can then administer that projects components and versions to which that permission scheme is attached, which is good and the behavior I expect.  However, there is an "Add Project" link available to this user... why?  they can't do that.  When it is clicked on, the user is the forced to log in again... no matter how many tries they try to login they cannot, usually.  HOWEVER, we have had one instance where when the user attempted to login, they got to a mangled screen (similar to the first problem) but on that screen, was an issue list of issues not in a project that that user has access to!  This is not good.  I can't reproduce it again no matter how many times I have tried, but it's was very scary to see.  We set up groups and permission schemes to keep people out of project they have no business being in, but this problem caused a user to get to somewhere where he should not have.
fields.summary: Login screen corrupted, displays arbitrary issue details, when password mistyped
Road map should use 'assigned' icon for assigned issues

fields.description: All calls need to be 4 seconds or less
fields.summary: make the system faster

fields.description:
Nevertheless original translation is excellent I've found there a lot of misprints and a few syntax and grammatical errors.

Also I added translations for a lot of new strings from locale_default.jar.

fields.summary: Stuck mail queue

fields.description: Our staff are assigned enterprise-wide user id's which are basically just numbers (i.e. "WB87678" = "John Smith").  However, it becomes difficult to assign users to issues because the user names in the dropdown list are sorted by the user id, not the name.  Would like a feature to sort the droplist by username instead of the ID to quickly find the user to assign.
fields.summary: Sorting or usernames

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a feature in the administration section that could close the site for all non administrative users. Users without administrator access would only receive a page that said:
--------

                        SITE IS DOWN


       <Reason text configurable in the admin section.>


--------

This would allow administrators to close the site before doing backups(exports) prior to upgrading the application, minimizing the chance for users to modify anything between a backup and an upgrade/restore.
fields.summary: Site is down for maintenance page

fields.description:
Question from the jira userlist :

Is it possible to change the order that comments appear for an issue?

For example, I'd like the most recent comments displayed at the top.
fields.summary: Change order of comments

fields.description: When using Jelly to create a comment there is no way to set the creation date of the comment.
fields.summary: Jelly Add Comment doesn't allow creation date to be set

fields.description: When I browse a project in our Jira there is a filter in "Open Issues" block called "by assignee". My account should have one open issue according to the view but there isn't any open issues assigned to me. Also the list shows that there are 0 "unassigned" issues that at least the previous versions didn't show at all.
fields.summary: Open Issues "by assignee" filter bug?

fields.description:
It is crucial to us to be able to find the bugs that have been resolved since our last release, so we can make release notes.  As it stands now, we can only filter on Date Updated.  This is not adaquate because people frequently comment on, or close bugs that have been resolved for a long time.  This means that old bugs often show up as recently resolved.

The same problem happens with the built-in "Resolved Recently" filter from the dashboard; it only searches for Resolved AND Updated Recently.
fields.summary: Enable filtering by Date Resolved

fields.description:
The Mantis importer has apparently broken when we introduced scanning for trackbacks:

Error importing data from bugzilla.java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException at
$Proxy31.createIssue(Unknown Source) at com.atlassian.jira.util.MantisImportBean.importIssue
(MantisImportBean.java:372) at com.atlassian.jira.util.MantisImportBean.importIssues
(MantisImportBean.java:307) at com.atlassian.jira.util.MantisImportBean.importProjects
(MantisImportBean.java:763) at com.atlassian.jira.util.MantisImportBean.doImport
(MantisImportBean.java:185) at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.MantisImport.doRun
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at
com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.notifyTrackbacks(DefaultIssueManager.java:174)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:163)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:130)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.CachingIssueManager.createIssue(CachingIssueManager.java:68)
... 74 more
fields.summary: Mantis importer fails with NullPointerException: "Illegal operation on empty result set"

fields.description:
A customer has requested that we provide an XML export of those products they have purchased from our Jira install so that they can import them into their Jira for read only browsing locally behind their firewall.

Currently, the import/export appears to say that it clears the database down and recreates from the back up. This is of insufficient granularity to provide the ability to move easily projects between Jira installations.

As we have encouraged the customers to go with Jira, can we encourage you to provide project level import/export where only the project being imported is blasted and not the whole database?

Many thanks if this is possible.

aadam@ludologic.com
fields.summary: Individual Project Import/Export Option extension to Back-Ups

fields.description:
During our development process we ask developers to create high-level issues say that are 3 months in size under which they add multiple sub-tasks.

It would be great to have the ability in the Issue Navigator to have a view where the sub-tasks were automatically nested under their parent tasks. A simple tree like view, which you already use when a particular issue was selected would be sufficient. The same ability would be great for the roadmap and timetracking reports as well.
fields.summary: Ability to nest subtasks in the issue navigator view

fields.description: If you have permission to edit an issue, but not permission to edit the security level, the existing security level of the issue will be cleared by the edit.
fields.summary: Security level cleared when editing issue

fields.description: The default list of fields in the issue navigator has become lost. I am not able to restore it or find a setting for it. When I go to view the list of issues. It shows no fields and we cannot reset it. I have added the fields in but do not have the exact same as before.
fields.summary: The default field list for Issue Navigator has become empty

fields.description:
Assume the following versions exist:

1.1
1.0.9
1.0.8
1.0.7
 ...

All of them are marked as 'released'.

The order above is the way versions should appear in the 'Change Log'.

The way these versions appear today is:

1.0.9
1.0.8
1.0.7
 ...
1.1
1.0.1
1.0

Because 1.1 is the latest of these versions, it should appear first in the list.
fields.summary: Sorting versions correctly

fields.description:
New bugs added are not showing up in the default filtered views.  

For instance, I added a new bug in one project.  From the project view I can see that my blocker category incremented, but any filter I select does not show the new bug.  I can go directly to the bug if I know the bug number.  

An email is generated for the new bug.  I've tried several dfferent projects with the same results.

We have rebooted the server but that did not clear up the problem.  Please email if you have any further questions.

Thank you
Mike Marshall
fields.summary: Jira items not seen with default filters

fields.description: We need to look at attachments in date order as well as by name.  This will make it easy to choose between attachments with the same filename.
fields.summary: Sort attachments by filename, secondarily by date

fields.description: We have the information, so we may as well display it.
fields.summary: Show author on manage attachments page

fields.description:
On 18/03/2004, at 3:33 PM, David Coldrick wrote:
                                                                                                                                                             
> Hi guys,
>
> Just to let you know that "Sun Java System" (prev know as Sun ONE -
> ain't marketing wonderful?) App Server 7 update 3 is now publically
> available from
> http://wwws.sun.com/software/download/app_servers.html.
>
> It should contain the fix for the problem we discussed in mid-November
> with overriding the Principal object . . .
>
> Regards,
> David
fields.summary: Create docs for installing JIRA on Sun ONE

fields.description: When the user edits and submits the form for General Configuration, the locale gets reset to the default (Danish or something).
fields.summary: Locale reset when general configuration is edited

fields.description:
The following issue includes an image attachment but the thumbnail is not displayed: 

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-982

Should handle "image/pjpeg" content-types correctly.
fields.summary: Image thumbnails not displayed when image content-type is "image/pjpeg"

fields.description:
The gzip filter breaks sitemesh on Orion.

This is because the filter is applied to included pages on Orion.
fields.summary: Gzip filter breaks on Orion

fields.description: Well hooray, we can now edit an issue's reporter (JRA-927). It would be great if we could bulk-edit reporter too.  For instance, bulk-change reporter before deleting the user (a common use-case).
fields.summary: Bulk edit reporter

fields.description: When a user views someone else's profile page (eg. by clicking on their name in an issue), it would be nice to include links to filters like "reported by this user".  These filters are actually included in the user's own view of their profile.  We just need to enable it for all users.
fields.summary: Add links to common filters in user profile page
Add permission for viewing email address in user profile

fields.description: Read-only custom fields would be very handy.  For instance, the Bugzilla importer could set a read-only field containing the old Bugzilla ID.  Currently if a custom field is created, it appears on the 'create issue' page as a field to be filled in.
fields.summary: Read-only custom fields
